strong.span:
The School District of University City has closed
all school buildings through the end of the 2019-20 school. year.

span.a: Click here for the April 9, 2020 letter from Superintendent Hardin-Bartley with more details.

strong.span: For more details, seeDistrict Newsor emailcommunications@ucityschools.orgwith any questions.

a.title: Go to comments for Closure End of School

p.span: The Revised 2020-21 school year calendaris now finalized.

br.span: Clickhere for 1-page PDF or click here to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for 2021 Calendar

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: An ongoing series of in-depth stories on the people, partnerships and programs that contribute to Learning Reimagined in The School District of University City

a.span: An ongoing series of in-depth stories on the people, partnerships and programs that contribute to Learning Reimagined in The School District of University City

a.title: Go to comments for An ongoing series of in-depth stories on the people, partnerships and programs that contribute to Learning Reimagined in The School District of University City

a.span: From Bullied to Celebrated: Meet UCHS 'Warrior' Nathan Turner

div.p: Get a sneak peek of UCHS junior Nathan Turner on the cable reality show Ink Master: Turf War and learn the uplifting story of how UCHS stopped bullying in its tracks. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for From Bullied to Celebrated: Meet UCHS 'Warrior' Nathan Turner

img.alt: University City High School Wins Big at the 2020 State Journalism Awards

a.span: University City High School Wins Big at the 2020 State Journalism Awards

div.p: Once again, our University City High School journalists raked in the state awards. This year's count: 32 awards! Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for University City High School Wins Big at the 2020 State Journalism Awards

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: District Update notice on Computer Screen

a.span: UPDATE: Building Closure Extended Through End of School Year

div.p: The School District of University City will now close its school buildings throughthe end of the school year. Click headline to read the April 9 letter from Superintendent Sharonica Hardin-Bartley.

a.title: Go to comments for UPDATE: Building Closure Extended Through End of School Year

img.alt: Want to Help During COVID-19? The UCEF Summer Meal Appeal Is Now Taking Donations

a.span: Want to Help During COVID-19? The UCEF Summer Meal Appeal Is Now Taking Donations

div.p: The University City Education Foundation has launched a Summer Meal Appeal to help University City families adversely affected by the COVID-19 virus. Your donation will enable The School District of University City to distribute essential weekly care packages containing fresh produce, canned goods, snacks and personal items to families. Donations are being taken now! Click headline to learn more.

a.title: Go to comments for Want to Help During COVID-19? The UCEF Summer Meal Appeal Is Now Taking Donations

img.alt: Public Comments Being Taken Ahead of the Next BOE Meeting

a.span: Public Comments Being Taken Ahead of the Next BOE Meeting

div.p: In response to the COVID-19 outbreak, the University City Board of Education is collecting public comments in advance of its regularly scheduled meetings. It's next meeting is scheduled for 7 p.m. Thursday, April 20. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Public Comments Being Taken Ahead of the Next BOE Meeting

div.p: Superintendent Hardin-Bartley checks in with families during morning and evening Zoom virtual meetings. Next meeting scheduled for April 20. Videos of the April 8 meetings and the chat questions can be reviewed by clicking the headline.

a.title: Go to comments for Zoom with the Superintendent

a.span: SDUC Remains Committed to Equity During COVID-19

div.p: Alive & Well Communities has released and excellent document on equity and trauma during the COVID-19 outbreak. The School District of University City pledges to keep equity and informed trauma response at the center of our work as we adjust learning and services to deal with the COVID-19 outbreak. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for SDUC Remains Committed to Equity During COVID-19

a.span: UPDATE: Grab & Go Meal Program Starts New Pick-Up Day Schedule the Week of April 6

div.p: Starting the week of April 6, Grab & Go meal pick-ups will be scaled-back to Tuesdays and Fridays. The District will further provide dinner for all students on weekdays, and breakfasts and lunches on the weekends. The free meal program is available to all U. City Schools students. Please note, families are allowed to pick-up the food by car or on foot during the St. Louis County "Stay at Home" order. Click headline to learn more details.

a.title: Go to comments for UPDATE: Grab & Go Meal Program Starts New Pick-Up Day Schedule the Week of April 6

img.alt: Distance Learning heart tree with houses

a.span: Parents: Student Distance Learning Hub Is Here

div.p: Learn more about the District's new one-stop-shop for information about Student Distance Learning by school and grade level. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Parents: Student Distance Learning Hub Is Here

a.span: Spirit Days on School Facebook Pages

div.p: A fun activity for students, staff and families of all ages! Help us stick together in U. City Schools by participating in our#TogtherUCitySchoolsspirit days on your school's Facebook page. Click headline for details and links.

a.title: Go to comments for Spirit Days on School Facebook Pages

img.alt: SDUC Quick Facts and Information on the District Response to COVID-19

a.span: SDUC Quick Facts and Information on the District Response to COVID-19

div.p: Here are quick links to get you to preliminary information on student distance learning, building contacts, superintendent letters, meal support and more. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for SDUC Quick Facts and Information on the District Response to COVID-19

img.alt: Ouchies? Colds? Asthma? Check Out School Nurse Health Tips

a.span: Ouchies? Colds? Asthma? Check Out School Nurse Health Tips

div.p: U. City'sschool health care team is here and ready to assist families with everyday medical questions. Please contact your school social worker, counselor or nurse as needed. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Ouchies? Colds? Asthma? Check Out School Nurse Health Tips

a.span: Self Care During Coronavirus? Absolutely! Here Are Some Resources

div.p: Self care is critically important, even during a crisis. Here are resources to help you be well during these stressful times. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Self Care During Coronavirus? Absolutely! Here Are Some Resources

img.alt: Need a Helping Hand? Here's a Full List of School and Community Resources

a.span: Need a Helping Hand? Here's a Full List of School and Community Resources

div.p: The District has compiled a complete list of community resources available to families to support well-being during this stressful time. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Need a Helping Hand? Here's a Full List of School and Community Resources

a.span: Important Note: Coronavirus Prevention and Our Schools

div.p: Here are helpful links on COVID-19. Read updates and information on preventative measures you can take with your family. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Important Note: Coronavirus Prevention and Our Schools

a.span: Everyone Counts! Please Participate in the 2020 U.S. Census

div.p: Responding to the 2020 Census is an easy, safe, and important way to help provide resources for children and their communities for the next 10 years. Click headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Everyone Counts! Please Participate in the 2020 U.S. Census
